intro: Distephanus quartziticola, commonly known as the quartziticola stephanus, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions with quartz-rich soils. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, often brightly colored flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy environments, showcasing adaptations to nutrient-poor conditions. Its leaves are usually small and succulent, aiding in water retention. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern.
